alert.note: Alert for Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued April 05 at 7:50PM MDT until April 06 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON THROUGH 8 PM WEDNESDAY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN AND CENTRAL NEW MEXICO BELOW SNOWPACK FOR STRONG WINDS, LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY AND AN UNSTABLE AIRMASS... .Overall, winds are starting to decrease in speed, and while a few locations may periodically experience gusts of 25 to 35 mph through the evening, the widespread threat for critical fire weather conditions is expected to relax for the remainder of this evening. However, critical fire weather conditions will return on Wednesday over much of western and central New Mexico where several hours of single digit relative humidity are forecast as northwest winds restrengthen. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * AREA AND TIMING...Northwest Plateau and Highlands, West Central Highlands, Middle Rio Grande Valley and Sandia, Manzano and Gallinas Mountains below any snowpack from noon to 8 pm Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...On Wednesday, northwest 20 to 35 mph with occasional gusts to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Dropping to 5 to 9 percent Wednesday afternoon. Up to 8 to 12 consecutive hours of single digit humidities are forecast Wednesday in the Middle Rio Grande Valley. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning.

area.areaDesc: Middle Rio Grande Valley; Northwest Highlands; Northwest Plateau; Sandia Manzano And Gallinas Mountains; West Central Highlands
